meanings.definition: To make a written or typed copy of spoken or recorded material.
meanings.sent1: She was transcribing the teacher's lecture into her notebook.
meanings.sent2: The secretary spent the afternoon transcribing the meeting notes.
meanings.sent3: While transcribing the interview, she accidentally added some funny emojis.
meanings.sent4: Transcribing the ancient text felt like deciphering a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The act of transcribing requires careful attention to detail.

meanings.definition: To convert (sound or speech) into a written or printed form.
meanings.sent1: He was transcribing the lyrics of his favorite song onto paper.
meanings.sent2: The software is capable of transcribing audio files accurately.
meanings.sent3: Transcribing the bird's chirping sounded like a musical composition.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved swiftly, transcribing the speech into text.
meanings.sent5: Transcribing the podcast made it accessible to those with hearing impairments.

meanings.sent1: The student was transcribing the poem for her literature assignment.
meanings.sent2: The scribe was transcribing the royal decree onto parchment.
meanings.sent3: Transcribing the recipe made her crave the dish even more.
meanings.sent4: His pen flew across the paper, transcribing the letter with precision.
meanings.sent5: Transcribing the document word for word ensured accuracy in the copy.
